medical_history.chief_complaint: Abrupt onset of severe left upper quadrant (LUQ) and back pain with associated nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in his usual state of health until yesterday evening when he suddenly developed severe abdominal pain and vomiting. Back pain accompanied the abdominal pain. He experienced chills but no fevers. His abdominal pain was more severe than prior episodes attributed to H. pylori. Improvement in abdominal pain was noted after admission, and the last bout of vomiting was last night.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Depression, anxiety, dyslipidemia (resolved), mild dementia, simple renal cyst.
medical_history.family_history: There is no family history of coronary artery disease, unexplained cardiomyopathy, or sudden cardiac death. No known family history of biliary or pancreatic disease.
